name: proteomicslfq-quantification
title: Proteomics Label-Free Quantification (nf-core/proteomicslfq)
description: Quantitative proteomics analysis using label-free quantification. Performs peptide identification, protein inference, and differential abundance analysis from mass spectrometry mzML data.
content:
Proteomics Label-Free Quantification

The nf-core/proteomicslfq pipeline performs comprehensive label-free quantitative proteomics analysis from mass spectrometry data (mzML format).

Scientific Applications

  • Biomarker Discovery: Identify disease-associated proteins
  • Drug Target Validation: Quantify protein expression changes
  • Pathway Analysis: Study protein-level regulation
  • Clinical Proteomics: Diagnostic and prognostic markers
  • Systems Biology: Multi-omics integration
  • Post-translational Modifications: PTM localization and quantification

Pipeline Features

  • Database Search: Multiple search engines (Comet, X!Tandem, MS-GF+)
  • FDR Control: Percolator re-scoring and filtering
  • Protein Inference: Group related proteins
  • LFQ Methods: Spectral counting or feature-based quantification
  • Statistical Analysis: MSstats for differential abundance
  • Quality Control: PTXQC comprehensive QC metrics

Input Requirements

Three required inputs:

  1. mzML files: Raw mass spectrometry data (converted from vendor formats)
  2. Protein Database: FASTA file with protein sequences
  3. Experimental Design: TSV file mapping samples to conditions

Key Outputs

  • Protein Quantification: Abundance matrices across samples
  • Differential Abundance: Statistical comparisons between conditions
  • PTM Localization: Modification site assignments
  • Quality Metrics: Comprehensive QC reports

Perfect for: Proteomics researchers • Clinical labs • Drug discovery • Biomarker studies • Systems biology
